cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi NNE of Camagüey, Cuba and 275 mi ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the Florida Keys Monday afternoon, then into the southeast Gulf of Mexico and toward the central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast (near the MS/AL coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama–Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, Louisiana (incl. Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, southern Florida peninsula, and central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind gusts possible Monday afternoon/evening; sustained 34-kt winds unlikely (≤3% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on Miami’s Atlantic side due to weak system and fast passage.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with isolated 8-inch pockets; risk of urban flash-flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional lightning and localized street flooding could disrupt cargo handling and gate operations.
